programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Seeing his tracks in the fresh snow inspires Little Nutbrown Hare to create a new game called ‘snow seek’. The friends have a lot of fun creating tracks for Little Nutbrown Hare to follow, but Little Redwood Fox’s tracks completely disappear and so does she. When Big Nutbrown Hare reports that Little Redwood Fox was sighted walking backwards, they work out how she managed to trick them all.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy likes football. What other things does Timmy like?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is throwing some awesome moves on the kitchen counter, dancing with his drink bottle in one hand. When he bounds into the garden and opens the drink, it fizzes out over the top and nearly all of it goes on the floor! He wonders why that happened, so he goes to Okido to find out! When he lands, Zoe and Felix are staring up at the sky because hundreds of birds are all flying in the same direction.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is making a new jigsaw puzzle in his bedroom and it’s of a dinosaur. “I’d love to see a REAL dinosaur,” he says. He wonders why he’s never seen one… So off he goes to Okido! Messy lands in Zoe and Felix’s garden and cartwheels down the path to catch up with them. Zoe and Felix are carrying sandcastle equipment – Messy picks up Felix’s bucket and puts it on his head. “What’s this?” he asks, “A new hat?” Felix and Zoe laugh and invite him to come to the beach with them. Messy speeds off in excitement!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple isnt paying attention when Strawberry describes their campout tradition of telling Tall Tales. So Apple tells her thrilling adventure of a wild road rally she entered, only to surprise the girls by proving the story is actually true.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry decides to imitate his Mum by becoming a newspaper reporter for the day.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that he cant have what he wants for breakfast he goes to Dino-world.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah, navigating the scorching Thar Desert, finds Hardwickes Spiny-Tailed Lizards seemingly braving the intense heat. Concerned for their well-being, she contacts Leo and Katie who are in the garden about to commence in a water gun chase but are interrupted when Hero steals the water gun. Upon consulting the computer, they learn that the lizards need sunlight to regulate their body temperature. During the call, a falcon appears and scares the lizards back into their burrows! Leo, Katie and Hero fly to the desert to help the lizards find a way to stay in the sun without being harmed by the falcon. Attempting to aid them, they construct a tent, only for it to crash to their disappointment. They meet with Ranger Rocky who seeks advice from Ranger Joey, they discover the importance of sunlight for these cold-blooded creatures. A lizard approaches the rangers, trusting them enough to be around them when suddenly the falcon swoops in towards it! Hero intervenes to protect the lizard from the falcon and it flies off. With Ranger Rockys assistance, they come up with a new plan to keep the falcon away instead of protecting the lizards. With CDs hung on a tree, it reflects light which scares the falcon. The lizards can now safely bask in the sun, marking the success of the mission. In the Treehouse, a water gun fight ensues between Leo and Katie.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas misses his best friend Percy while working on the Chinese railway.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. She makes several mistakes, and worries she doesn’t fit in with the other engines. Nia encourages Darcy to be herself and she soon makes up for her mistakes when everyone sees what she can really do!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: As every year, Maria is set to take part in the pizza contest. But she sprains her wrist at the last moment and, unable to cook, cant participate. So David asks Grisu to cook in her stead. Its the perfect mission for Grisu, who loves pizza (and his father even more). Maria instructs him – and Stella – on how to make the Pizza Nonna, according to her grandmothers recipe. But things go haywire, Grisu unwittingly ends up tied to the ceiling fan, spinning fast, kicking everything and making a mess in the kitchen, plus he burns the recipe. As all hope seems lost, Grisu, who never gives up, has Maria sing a lullaby, which makes her remember the recipe. Thanks to that, they make the best pizza ever and go on to win the contest.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Toramento has to decorate Dragontown with flowers for its yearly ball. But as he got the flowers delivered too late, he wont be able to finish his task on time. So David asks Grisu to help out Toramento and be his assistant gardener. The young dragon is in charge of making flowerbed depicting a volcano in the town square – even though Fume would rather have his son use cactuses instead of flowers. Things dont go exactly as planned. First, the soil is too hard, and then Thingy unearths most flowers Grisu and Stella have managed to plant.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. Little Nutbrown Hare is surprised that Big Nutbrown Hare knows every single creature in the meadow. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their Town Crier badges, Wilson and Brewster each have to make an announcement, speaking loudly, clearly and with style. Brewster is too quiet and nobody listens to him. Wilson is loud and clear, but he exaggerates! Having failed their first badge attempt, Wilson and Brewster decide to help each other. Brewster teaches Wilson how to stick to the facts and Wilson gives Brewster pointers on announcing with pizzazz. They both earn their badges on the second try!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie wants to give her brothers a surprise afternoon snack in the forest. She needs Lucien, Loudo’s father’s help. He will accompany them to the wild bees nest that she has found. However, Berry’s unexpected presence will threaten Rosie’s plans.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob must finish a Dinosaur Park attraction for the Mayor to visit that evening. This involves creating a trail around which life-sized models of dinosaurs will be positioned, climaxing with a roaring animatronic model of a triceratops. Muck starts to clear the main path. He’s fascinated, but also a little bit scared of dinosaurs. Leo reassures Muck by revealing he too was a bit wary of dinosaurs when he was small, and gets Muck to roar like a dinosaur. The model dinosaurs arrive and are very impressive. Scoop decides to surprise Leo and pushes the triceratops into the middle of the path. Instead of surprising Leo, they spook Muck who panics and knocks the model over a cliff.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Wendy, Leo, Scoop and Lofty are completing the second stage of a bridge over the River Coil in Spring City. This involves building a spar and building out a bridge deck, which is held up by cables attached to the spar. The bridge is due to be complete by Monday morning, in time for the city-folk to get to work. Scoop is sceptical about Leo’s claims to have caught a fish in the river; Scoop doesn’t like fish. The team learn from Mr Bentley that Mayor Madison has re-routed the next day’s Spring City Quarter Marathon to finish on the bridge, which means they need to finish the bridge by the end of the day. The bridge will be officially opened by the winner crossing the bridge finishing line. When Scoop dips his digger into the river he accidentally catches a fish in his bucket.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie and Hero travel to Peru to take a marvellous spatuletail home. But what can they do when the hungry bird falls into a deep sleep?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a wild boar in their garden back to the forest. There, Ranger Rocky advises the Junior Rangers to find the boar’s sounder, which is a group of female wild boars and their young children.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are playing Frisbee on the beach when they discover a little, dented and rusty treasure chest. Wow, it looks like a pirate chest! Simon decides right then that they should be playing pirates and should fill it up with a treasure and then hide it and make a treasure map! The boys fill it with seashells. Simon won’t let Gaspard put a dirty old sock in with the shells! Or a conch shell, which is way too big. Once the treasure chest is full, Simon and Gaspard run over to Grandma and Grandpa to get some paper and crayons to draw the treasure map.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly insist on seeing an octopus. They manage to get to the home island of the octopus and in the way back home rainbow-fishes help them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The violin of the poor Cricket breaks. Berry and Dolly takes care that neither the Cricket nor the other animals remain without instrument and music.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly helps Christopher, the canary who broke his wing. In gratitude Christopher takes Dolly to the island where the yellow ladybird lives.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry visits his distant relative, Snail Sam.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: While Tilda is having a picnic by the river with her friends, Snaily creeps into the garden to look for food. He sees another snail that has fallen asleep on the wall of the house and is threatening to dry out. Courageously, Snaily saves the other snail, but in doing so gets trapped under a bucket.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda one morning wakes up especially early, she is visited by Robin. He tells her that he as a robin wakes the sun every morning and invites Tilda to join him the following day. For this, however, Tilda has to get up at half past four! That evening, shes so excited she has difficulty going to bed early.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert has always dreamed of living in the woods. And Tilda thinks wishes like that should be fulfilled. So Tilda, Rupert and Molly set out to spend a night in the forest. Rupert is amused by all the luggage the ladies are taking with them – for him, the woods have everything one could need! He soon discovers that its not that easy...

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. It’s too little to speak and doesn’t look like any creature Little Nutbrown Hare or his friends have seen before. How will he return it to its parents if he doesn’t know what kind of creature it is?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Everyone is preparing their dance acts for the school talent show, but Ferdinand and Simon think that their act is too clumsy and that they wont be able to go on stage with it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a baby plantain squirrel eating his seed collection. The Junior Rangers drive to the forest to locate the squirrel’s nest and mother.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster and Koko have to find coloured cars by solving riddles that will let them know where they’re hidden. Competitive Koko is afraid Brewster will finish before she does – so when she stumbles across one of his cars, she hides it. Koko finishes before Brewster, but when Vee tells her the task can’t be completed until they both put their cars together – Koko realises she’s done the wrong thing. She confesses, and together they line the cars up to make a rainbow!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Koko and Brewster must ride the rails and report any problems. Emery reported 10 problems when he earned his badge, and they decide to beat that record. They split up. But Brewster’s patrol is interrupted when he tries to catch a naughty, escaped monkey who is wreaking havoc - and he doesn’t report anything. They’re disappointed they haven’t beaten the record, but when Brewster explains why he didn’t report and tells Vee about the problems the monkey caused, he learns that those problems count as a report! Koko and Brewster win their badges – and beat Emery’s record!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is proud to have been put in charge of feeding Nina’s animals while she’s away. But when he accidentally drops some eggs and commits a series of blunders, the animals change their behavior, and even seem to start avoiding him! Are they upset with T’choupi for being so clumsy?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi discovers Nina’s beautiful dried flowers. He’s so impressed that he wants to make his own collection, as a birthday present for his mom! So, he Nina and Benedicte secretly head off to pick some pretty flowers. But they’re going to have to turn it around fast: they only have one day to get the job done!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Tonight, Louis is invited to Charleys house. But when Charley puts on Louis glasses for a laugh at the table, Mum and Dad are struck by their resemblance. So in the morning, the two friends have fun... swapping clothes! But at school, everything goes wrong: its not so easy to pass off as each other!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam, Julia, and the other kids in the Mouse Mansion read the adventures of Magic Mouse, a magazine hero. But one day, some of them are helped by Magic Mouse who seems to really exist...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia always play together. Tonio and Ella challenge them to spend an afternoon without each other. But will they be able to do it, and even try to see each other without being seen?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Toby is always nervous when he has to go through Knapford Junction with the big gantry signal over the track. One day Toby waits nervously for his signal to change, but it stays on red. He waits and waits, holding up other engines, but the signal doesn’t change. The Fat Controller is very cross until everybody finally realises the signal is broken.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Oliver is always telling his brake van Toad about his adventures and Toad longs to have an adventure of his own. So when the chance comes to work with James, Toad is very excited. But James doesn’t like pulling trucks and goes too fast and then, when a coupling snaps, Toad gets a bigger adventure than he bargained for.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets his first loose tooth and prepares for a visit from the Tooth Fairy!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Daddy helps Caillou prepare magic tricks for the school talent show!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Walking on stilts is difficult even for a talented athlete like Monkey; And it is even more difficult if one stilts breaks and the other gets stuck in the mud…but not to worry, Flamingo is here to save the day. Once out of the mud, Monkey invites Flamingo to play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Trying to see as much of the beautiful savanna’s view as possible; Monkey climbs higher and higher up the tree. At this height there is only one friend Monkey can meet… the Giraffe is ready and willing to play Monkey’s favorite game Monkey see Monkey Do.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Professor Pickles leads Hannah, Sarah and James on an epic quest to find the Ancient Pontypandy Way. But when it gets dark, he makes a flaming torch and accidentally sets the forest on fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman tries to finish his Sea Life Spotting project but ends up stranded in a cave by rising tides. Sam pilots Juno to rescue him just in time.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: While doing their “Who’s Who in Woodland” project - a school assignment where the kids have to find out more about the people in their community - Franklin and Bear assume they already know all there is to know about Mr. Groundhog. But in doing so they almost miss out on a bunch of cool stuff, like the fact he’s actually Woodland’s own expert weatherman! / When Franklin and Fox decide they want to be inventors just like Mr. Fox, they find that tinkering and experimenting are just as important to the process as following a plan. With open minds, they even invent some pretty cool gadgets along the way!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie dreams of winning this years Raffle prize: a set of colored paints! So when she learns that the Cats intend to cheat in order to win it, only to waste it away… she makes a bad decision: she’ll be cheating too.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to succeed in doing his magic tricks, but he fails them all the time. Doodleboo is no more talented than he, but he has a magic Riddleboo for his friend to discover!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Looking at a picture of the desert, Sketcky wonders what one could do in such a huge desert. Doodleboo has an idea of Riddleboo, full of travels and surprises!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky has no idea how to go to space and approach the biggest star. Fortunately, Doodleboo has a Riddleboo that could help him travel in space.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Hatty deliver pumpkins to all their friends at Halloween. Their friends have all requested different numbers of pumpkins, as well as different sizes and colours, so they have to remember which pumpkin is for which friend and make sure they deliver them correctly. Dave wants to know who the giant pumpkin is for; but that’s just one of Hatty’s Halloween surprises - there will be costumes, pumpkin lanterns, pumpkin pie and even a party!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty takes Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to the big Countryside Swap, to swap things they no longer want or need. Hatty explains the golden rule of swapping is ‘once it’s gone it’s gone,’ but Dave insists that he’s too old for his cuddly blanket and wants to swap it. But as soon as he’s made the swap, he regrets the trade and wants it back! Can they trace the chain of swaps back to the new owner and persuade them to swap for something else?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare has a new game. He will be Big Nutbrown Hare for a day, doing jobs like finding food, answering tricky questions and resting in the grass. Likewise, Big Nutbrown Hare must take on his son’s jobs of playing with his friends, making up new games and asking questions. It’s all great fun until they realize that they are much, much better at being themselves.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot suggests he should take some music lessons. Mole appears explaining how the cricket is world renowned for his musical abilities... They go to the meadow and hear the beautiful music of cricket who tells Monkey how he has been playing for years. Soon Cricket joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: An underwater shoot goes wrong when James gets wedged in the rocks, just as the tide starts coming in!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A hunt for dinosaur bones leads to a search and rescue mission with the Police Helicopter, FireSwift, Radar and Shadow!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: When Kate can’t jump high enough to retrieve a ball stuck in a tree, she wonders what it would be like to have superpowers. In Mimiloo, Tack’s new Supercharger invention gives everyone superpowers! But their new abilities aren’t enough to get Boomer out of a bouncy predicament.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate can’t get the timing right to jump rope. In Mimiloo, Gobble has a case of the sneezy snorts and needs boom chicka bee honey tea to feel better. In order to get the honey, Kate must lead her friends to find the beat and make the most beautiful music the bees have ever heard.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina are very excited today as Mom and Dad have organized a treasure hunt for them in the forest! Tchoupi is very confident he’ll find the treasure in no time as he and Nina have prepared for it. As they move from clue to clue, the two friends have fun discovering other aspects of the forest, but Tchoupi starts to get impatient: why’s it taking so long to find the treasure??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! They manage to track her down, nestling nice and cozy inside Loupiote the dog’s kennel, of all places! She’s come here to lay her eggs and she intends to stay! T’choupi and Nina try to coax her out with various treats… in vain. The problem is, Loupiote is out of a home right now!... But what if they were to find her another kennel??

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia always play together. Tonio and Ella challenge them to spend an afternoon without each other. But will they be able to do it, and even try to see each other without being seen?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly loses the sack of Christmas wishes, and Tildas oven breaks. Thankfully, a wandering craftsman returns the sack and fixes the oven. But Tilda is sad—Aunt Emily can’t come for Christmas due to a broken leg.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets want to take part in the great sandcastle contest organized at the beach. Turbulent and Poet decide to build theirs together and Girl would have liked to team up with Mom, but the competition is for kids only. She asks a little English girl to be her partner! However, when the stopwatch starts, the language differences make things quite complicated, while Turbulent and Poet are convinced they will win. But language barriers are not match for fun!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Have you ever dream about to have a twin sister too? Or two soon? In this series, you can follow the unusual adventures of three twin sisters. Fun and laughter are guaranteed!Money business? Thats complicated! Right after cleaning up their Grandfathers garden, the Triplets were given a jam jar full of golden coins. Grandfather told them to use it wisely. The Triplets are truly amazed, but what could they possibly do with all that money? Spend it? Keep it? Poet decides to spend it all for his family while Turbulent would rather keep it for when hell be grown up. But after a misunderstanding the twins get in a fight. Will money tear apart the two brothers?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie has agreed to lend her colored paint to Woodsy, so that he can paint a coat of arms on a pretty bark. But when she finds out that during her absence Scoutbadger has also borrowed some of her paint and emptied all the colors, she’s very unhappy! Fortunately, the twins have set about a quest to make it up to her…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou shares a story about his first time going skiing.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou helps Daddy with grown-up work on Take Your Kid to Work Day!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel always likes to appear rough and tough in front of Arry and Bert. But when Thomas, unexpectedly, finds him lovingly fussing over some baby ducklings he threatens to tell everyone that Diesel is just a big softie. Diesel is horrified and promises to be nice to everyone in exchange for Thomas not telling anyone about the ducklings. All the engines are pleasantly surprised when Diesel starts being polite and friendly, but just how long can he keep it up?

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Koko decides to try for the High Speed badge - something no trainee has ever won. Emery wishes he still earned badges like the trainees do. For fun, he plays a pretend badge game with Hoot and Toot, where they award each other imaginary badges. Emery is so busy playing his game that he doesn’t listen when Vee assigns him to take some supporters to the footbridge to cheer Koko on. Realising that he was so wrapped up in his pretend badge game, he forgot how important the real badge was for Koko, he takes it upon himself to be her number one cheerleader.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Toot doesn’t want to do track inspection with Hoot. To get out of it, she pretends she isn’t feeling well. At first she enjoys getting lots of attention, but when Morgan thinks her flywheel needs replacing, which means having her engine taken out and spending the night in the repair shed, Toot realises she’s gone too far. She confesses that there’s nothing wrong with her - she just didn’t want to do the track inspection! Toot realises she has caused a lot of trouble for everyone and promises never to do it again. She and Hoot head off to do the track inspection. Actually, It turns out to be really fun and Toot realises she was making a fuss over nothing.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Tonight, Louis is invited to Charleys house. But when Charley puts on Louis glasses for a laugh at the table, Mum and Dad are struck by their resemblance. So in the morning, the two friends have fun... swapping clothes! But at school, everything goes wrong: its not so easy to pass off as each other!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make up a song of jungle animal noises. Listening carefully to the sounds their jungle friends make, they learn how to ‘Oooh-Oooh-ooh’ like a monkey, ‘kaw’ like a parrot and ‘roar’ like a Leopard - and everyone joins them in singing their special Jungle Song!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What would we need if we adopted a baby dragon? Doodledoo explains how to draw a Fire Truck.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this episode, the Junior Rangers attempt to return a crab-eating macaque to the wild. Their knowledgeable friend, Ranger Rocky, assists them in their journey through the rainforest.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Sour teasing Apple escalates into a prank war between the two of them. After the girls feud disrupts the town, they are sentenced in a Berry Bitty City-style trial to camp alone together for a whole weekend. Miraculously, they emerge best buds, and their friends are relieved, until Sours influence on Apple turns her into a mini-Sour, and they have to do a personality makeover on Apple.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Woodsy and Scoutbadger have decided to play a big game of hide-and-seek, but their plan falls through when their parents announce that, in the afternoon, they have to babysit their kid sister Berry. Despite her brothers doubts, Rosie suggests that Berry take part in the game. It quickly becomes obvious that Berry is too little for a real hide-and-seek.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mommy has a great news for the Triplet’s, Mrs Bun, Nini’s mom, is going to have a baby ! The Triplets are super excited but Mommy warns them, Nini may not be so happy about it because it’s not always easy to accept a new baby at home. And indeed, when Eliott and The Triplets arrive at the bakery, Nini is very sad, she doesn’t want this new baby. Mrs Bun, who needs to go to the doctor, gives the key of the shop to Eliott and the children and they are going to do everything that’s possible to make Nini smiles and they’re gonna prove her to have siblings is really really fun !

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: We’re at home with the Triplets and it’s practically time to go to bed, our three children are quietly watching TV, a documentary about firemen which passionates Turbulent. But Girl and Poet are not really happy about it, they’d rather watch a fairytail or a documentary about animals. Next, we have a quarrel for the remote control. After all, the zapper is a magical wand which does whatever you want. But these squabbles drives Mommy crazy and she takes the remote away! When you don’t have a zapper anymore, you just have to make your own TV: the Triplet’s TV!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Look up in the sky! Is it a bird? A plane? No, its Space Chuggers!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: An underwater shoot goes wrong when James gets wedged in the rocks, just as the tide starts coming in!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A hunt for dinosaur bones leads to a search and rescue mission with the Police Helicopter, FireSwift, Radar and Shadow!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate is looking for fireflies, but they keep flying away without lighting up. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and the Sniffer Finder, a rambunctious robot dog, help Lily look for her favourite magical animal, a unicorn, by tracking its favourite food—shimmer flowers! When every patch of flowers they find has already been eaten, it’s up to Kate to discover why.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s too small to carry flower pots and can’t help her parents. In Mimiloo, Tack’s shrinking violet petals fly all over Kate and Mim-Mim, shrinking them to insect-size! To return to regular size, they must traverse the vast jungle of Gobble’s garden. It’s a daunting journey, until they meet Tiny, a teeny little ant who can do big things!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou cant wait to open the mysterious box Daddy brought home, he imagines hes an explorer searching for the Lost City accompanied by his assistant (Rosie). By being patient, they finally find the city and Caillou discovers that some things are worth waiting for.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Gilbert decides to sleep in Rosie’s room, Caillou feels so lonely that he pretends to be a castaway stranded on a deserted island. To get back home, Caillou builds a raft with island buddies Teddy and Rexy and realizes that because he has his friends, he’s not alone at all.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone knows James is choosy about his work, so he’s delighted to be picked to take the Mayor and the Fat Controller to a ball in Vicarstown and promises to do all his other jobs without complaint. But James is horrified at the end of the daywhen his guard finds a tiny scratch on his paintwork! He insists on being repainted, thinking his speed and the windy weather will dry him, but leaves and twigs stick to his wet paint as he zooms along instead. James has to swallow his pride and ask Edward to do his special job. Luckily after Edward explains why James messed up, James gets another chance to shine.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers help a mob of Meerkats find a new home.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo does something to upset Pico. He flies away and doesnt return. The Junior Rangers learn about Toco Toucans to try and figure out where Pico might have gone. Can the Junior Rangers bring Peyo and Pico back together again?

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The Thompsons family pigeon, Cedric, has been reported found in Northern Ireland. Pat must take Dorothy and Bill to help bring him back in the SDS Plane. Meanwhile Alf camps out at the sorting office, pining for his beloved Cedrics return. Once in Ireland, Pat meets the man who found Cedric and Dorothy manages to charm him down from his roof. Unfortunately an inopportune phone call from Alf startles cedric and causes him to take up a roost on a cliff face with a friendly puffin.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must deliver an old bath tub to Pencaster Lighthouse. But when he goes to collect it from Thompson Ground, the bath ends up rolling away into Greendale with Jess inside! When Pat catches up with the bath he finds PC Selby about to impound it for being an un-road-worthy vehicle. Pat explains its a Special Delivery and at last gets on his way. But when he arrives in Pencaster Bay, Micawber and Jess between them manage to loosen the rope tying up the SDS Boat and it goes chugging off to sea with no one on board! So Pat and Jess use the bath as a boat and paddle out to rescue the boat then at last deliver the old bath to Chris. SDS Mission accomplished - mioaw!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to dig the biggest hole and gets upset when Pando accidentally fills it in.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one – match! At first it’s fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald tries roller-skating in Big City Park only to keep falling over. Daisy tries to teach him, and Johnny Snowman gives him a pep talk, but after Oswald falls into Fish Fountain, he is ready to give up. But then Madame Butterfly loses control of Catrina’s pram and it starts rolling wildly through the park, heading straight for Big Pond. Oswald sees the danger and, without thinking, roller-skates to the rescue!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie spend their very first sleepover with Henry but soon find that staying at someone else’s house can be very different. They have trout balls and spaghetti for dinner, which they would never have at home, and watch “Penguin Patrol” instead of “Sammy Starfish” – Oswald’s favourite TV programme. Best of all, they learn the Penguin Polka and realise trying out new things is fun.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new penguin pool at Spring City Zoo. It’s almost complete when Lofty accidentally drops a large rock, which smashes the observation window. It’s urgent that they fix it quickly because the penguins will be arriving any moment. Meanwhile Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley are entertaining a special visitor, the grouchy Mayor Snipe from Riverdale. They take him on a tour of the city, but he isn’t impressed with the castle, the sports stadium or the revolving restaurant.Back at the zoo the penguins have arrived, but the pool isn’t ready for them yet. Leo has been busy working on a new pond and water feature at The Town Hall, and Lofty suggests the penguins can stay there until their new home is ready.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team arrive at the Racetrack to build three horse stables the day before a big race. At the sight of the horses, Leo goes into ‘cowboy mode’ for the duration of the build. Henry Corner, the anxious groom, wants the build to be as noise-free as possible for the sake of his nervy horses, which is exactly when the noisy Two-Tonne arrives in reverse. The build progresses well, until, getting carried away lassoing with some spare ropes, Leo scares the horses, who escape from their paddock and kick out at the nearly-built stables in their excitement. The stables collapse like dominos! Bob and Scoop have to round up the horses now galloping around the racetrack while Wendy’s quick thinking and Lofty’s help steers them back safely into their paddock. But the stables still need to be built all over again and now it’s nearly dusk. A contrite Leo thinks he may have a solution, but what?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse finds a sparkly rock and announces that it’s treasure. Little Nutbrown Hare wants a sparkly treasure too, so they set about finding him one that night, by the silvery light of the full moon. Together, they discover that treasure is found in the most unexpected places. When a very ordinary looking rock cracks open to reveal sparkly crystals inside, Little Nutbrown Hare realises that things are not always what they seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Winter snow is softening in the meadow and Big Nutbrown Hare finds some beautiful flowers peeking through the snow, a sure sign that Spring is finally on its way. Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants to show Big Nutbrown Hare something special too, something he has never seen before. With the help of his friends Little Nutbrown Hares comes up with a very special and unique treat!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Otus has a toy truck and the class have built an obstacle course. What shapes are the obstacles?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Hilda arrives at Sallys dance party, shes suddenly struck with a severe case of the sneezes. Thinking shes come down with a cold, her friends take her to Doctor Lion who informs her she has an allergy to something. It turns out shes allergic to her best friend Sally - or rather, the new rose-scented perfume Sallys wearing./Huckle, Lowly and Sally find they have their mystery-solving hands full when things start disappearing, in the blink of an eye!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the garden, jumping around excitedly. He bounds from left to right but accidentally catches his foot on a garden hose, which sends him flying. He lands with an awkward bump. Messy sits up and rubs his elbow that caught his fall. “Hmmm”, says Messy, “my elbow feels really hard but my tummy feels soft”. He wonders why some parts of his body feel harder than others. It’s off to Okido to find out. He lands in Okido with a leap and jump. “Who’s this?” asks Messy as he’s greeted by a little dog. YAP YAP YAP barks the dog, just as Zoe and Felix arrive to join him.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is in his garden looking at ants. He notices how they move in lines and come in and out of a hole in the ground! He wonders why – it’s off to Okido to find out! Messy crash lands in front of Zoe and Felix who are holding a cake. They tell him that it’s Mayor Oki’s birthday so they’re having a picnic so they zip off to the park to meet Zim, Zam and Zoom. Felix, Zoe and Messy are a little disappointed on arrival when see that the picnic food Zim, Zam and Zoom have brought is TINY…

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apples rave review on her berryweb page of Strawberrys new dessert starts a booming mail order dessert business for Berry Bitty City. When Strawberrys stuffed-up nose makes her bake a bad-tasting cake, Apple, afraid the truth will hurt Strawberrys reputation, proclaims its delicious. The fib snowballs when the Queen of Berryvania reads Apples review and orders Strawberrys new cake for her ball. A madcap chase ensues as Apple tries to stop the airmail postal bees from delivering the cake.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry fails to see any benefit in rain when a visit to the beach is rained off.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and Charlie have their football confiscated because they are unable to play football together without arguing.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the lush Amazon Rainforest, explorer Peyos discovery of a rare orchid takes an unexpected turn when playful pygmy marmoset younglings snatch it away. Believing them to be babies, Peyo calls the Junior Rangers - Leo, Katie, and Hero who were in the Garden, having fun imitating dances with each other. The team learns about pygmy marmosets, the worlds smallest monkeys from the computer. Arriving in the Amazon, they help Peyo to reunite the younglings with their family but first, they have to catch them as they keep jumping away! A spirited chase ensues with Hero, Pico, and the Junior Rangers pursuing the mischievous monkeys. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who successfully catches one of the monkeys. Ranger Joey shares valuable insights into pygmy marmoset behavior. They find the monkey family near a river by finding trees with holes in them caused by the monkeys. But suddenly, Peyo alerts Leo and Katie of the monkeys playing on a branch dangerously close to the river. The branch snaps but with swift action from Leo, the monkeys are saved and returned to their family. Back at the Treehouse, Leo calls it a mission accomplished and finds Katie dizzy from trying to imitate Hero chasing his tail.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily loves listening to stories of Nias travels - she has been all the way around the world and had some big adventures. It feels like ages since Emily left Sodor to go to the Great Railway Show - and everyones heard that story already. Rebecca can see that Emily is longing for a bit of adventure and so, when Nia is asked to take the Sodor Rangers up to Callan Castle, Rebecca suggests that Emily do the job instead. Emily ends up derailed and lost in the fog. But when Nia comes to the rescue she finds an exciting girls-together campsite! Emily and Nia camp out all night with the Sodor Rangers! The two friends return in the morning with an exciting story to tell!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas’ new Italian friends, Lorenzo and his coach Beppe, do everything together, but one day, Lorenzo decides he’d like to do things by himself for a change. Beppe is hurt when Lorenzo leaves him behind so he can deliver the legendary Opera Star, Bella Canto, to a music festival. Lorenzo meets his match in Bella - she’s a soloist and a diva who wants to do everything by herself, her way! She doesn’t let Lorenzo join in with her singing and demands he take her a different route. Not wanting to let her down, Lorenzo follows her command, but without his trusty Beppe – and his sense of direction – they end up lost! Luckily, Beppe knows that, deep down, his friend needs him, so comes to rescue and the pair are reunited once more.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu goes to the desert (with Fume) as an apprentice paleontologist to help Smeraldo in his excavations, tracking the skeleton of the legendary ancestor of all dragons, the “Dragonosaurus”. They get caught in a sandstorm with Stella Olivia and Smeraldo and take shelter in what happens to be the skeleton they were looking for.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The firefighters’s ladder has disappeared. Grisu and Stella conduct the investigation… They find some clues. Helped by Thingys sense of smell, Grisu follows a track that leads them to Daisy, the florist. They quickly realize that this is a wrong trail. Then, Thingy leads them to the pizzeria but its only because the dog is very foodie. Step by step, the mystery becomes deeper and deeper, and Grisu ends up feeling discouraged. But even if they followed wrong tracks, they also gathered information and clues that finally help Grisu to find the culprit who is none other than… Fume. In fact, he didnt steal the ladder but he borrowed it instead, leaving a note that Thingy has eaten!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare falls into a muddy Autumn puddle and is delighted when he startles Little Grey Squirrel, who doesn’t recognize him at first. This starts a great new game of ‘Surprise!’ as they dress up in disguises to surprise the others. But they weren’t ready for Little Field Mouse, who works out a clever way of surprising her friends even more.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko and Brewster are trying for their Courier badges. They each have to deliver three packages before five o’clock. But after two deliveries, Koko’s badge quest is interrupted when Eddie needs her to take him to an emergency track repair. Koko thinks she hasn’t won her badge – until Vee says that, as Koko has ‘delivered’ him to the track repair, Eddie can count as the third package

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Every year, the great inter-burrow games sees the children of the forest competing in a series of events. Each family must choose someone to represent them. It is difficult for our composite family (Fox-Badger) to chose a child, especially when Scoutbadger and Rosie both want to participate.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team have been building a new monorail system that goes across Spring City. Now they only have the last station to complete before the train takes its first journey that evening. But when Bob leaves Leo to finish the last station’s platform, Leo has trouble to concentrate on one job at a time. Leo tries to juggle three jobs at once with lots of different questions from Dizzy, Lofty and Tiny. Soon the cement is dripping onto the tracks, the platform tiles overload and break, and the roof crashes into the track and bends it out of shape. Leo thought things couldn’t get any worse until he realises that Bob is testing the train... and it’s heading for the bend in the track! As the train gets closer and closer, Leo finds it harder to decide what to do. But soon he takes control of the situation and concentrates.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Film director, Carl Parker, has commissioned Bob and his team to build the set and rocket for a movie – Space Robots 3. The clock is ticking, as they need to release it before Christmas. Leo reveals to Scoop he has aspirations to act, whilst Carl seems to have little control over his remote controlled robot D11D that keeps spooking Muck and running over Wendy’s toe. Saffi, who is hanging around the studio gates, is a big fan of D11D which leads an eager-to-impress Leo to claim he will be acting in the film, not just building sets. Leo with Scoop’s help then tries to get the director’s attention in various scenes whilst Bob’s team and the director are trying to get the set and rocket ready for filming. Leo decides to give up but then has an idea. The next morning, the first day’s filming is due to start but Leo is nowhere to be seen. Carl calls action on the first scene (between D11D and a much larger robot.)

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Its midday and Busytown citizens are dozing off all over town. Huckle, Sally and Lowly try to find out why. Noticing the number of sleeping people holding melted ice cream cones is an important clue. Ultimately, the kids discover that the ice cream truck isnt playing the usual perky tune to announce its arrival - its playing a lullaby./Someone has taken Huckle’s car and left their car in its place!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Who’s that hopping into the garden? Why, it’s a yellow-footed rock-wallaby—and its baby! The Junior Rangers hightail it to Australia to send mother and child home, but will a couple of flat tires throw a spanner in the works?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are spending the night at Grandpa and Grandmas house when a strange creature with red eyes flies by their window, causing both boys to howl with fear!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly gets a present but they start a fight to posess it. Finally turns out that they got a tandem bicycle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
